translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: درخواست کننده ای عذابی را که واقع شدنی است درخواست کرد،

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: پرسنده‌اى از عذابى پرسيد كه‌

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: سؤال كننده‌اى [از كفار] عذابى حتمى را درخواست كرد

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: پرسنده‌اى از عذاب واقع‌شونده‌اى پرسيد،

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: سائلی از عذاب قیامت که وقوعش حتمی است (از رسول) پرسید (که آن عذاب چه مردمی راست).

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: خواستاری (از روی تمسخر) درخواست عذابی کرد که به وقوع می‌پیوندد. [[«سَأَلَ»: درخواست کرد. تقاضا کرد. «سَآئِلٌ»: خواستار. تقاضا کننده. تنوین آن برای تحقیر است. «عَذَابٍ وَاقِعٍ»: عذاب رخ دهنده. مراد عذاب استیصال دنیوی و یا عذاب دردناک و سرمدی اخروی است. یعنی فرد حقیری از مستکبران گفت: اگر راست می‌گوئی که بلا و مصیبت دنیوی، و یا عذاب شدید اخروی حق است، هم اینک از خدا بخواه که ما را بدان گرفتار کند (نگا: انفال / 32، ص / 16). معنی دیگر آیه: پرسنده‌ای درباره عذاب محقّق الوقوع اخروی پرسش کرد که: کی می‌آید؟ مرادش این بود که هرگز نمی‌آید.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: خواهنده‌ای عذابی رخ دادنی را طلب کرد

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: تقاضاکننده‌ای تقاضای عذابی کرد که واقع شد!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: پرسید پرسش‌کننده‌ای از عذابی فرودآینده‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: پُرسنده‌اى عذابى را كه بودنى- واقع شدنى- است درخواست نمود

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: پرسنده‌ای به (علت) عذاب واقع‌شونده‌ای (از آنکه اگر واقعیت دارد پس چرا اکنون از آن اثری نیست،) پرسید.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: AN INQUIRER ASKED for the affliction that is to come

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: A requester seeks the punishment that will take place –

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: A questioner asked of a chastisement about to fall

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: There hath asked an asker for the torment about to befall.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: A questioner asked concerning a torment about to befall

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: A questioner questioned the imminent torment.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: A beseecher besought the visitation of chastisement,

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: A questioner asked concerning a torment about to befall

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: A questioner questioned concerning the doom about to fall

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: An asker asked for a punishment sure to befall

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: A caller supplicated about a punishment to fall on

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: A supplicant asked for a punishment bound to happen

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: Someone has (needlessly) demanded to experience the torment (of God),

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: One demanding, demanded the chastisement which must befall

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Saala sailun biAAathabin waqiAAin

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: A doubter once demanded that punishment be immediately meted out,

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: A questioner asked about a Penalty to befall-

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: [عذابی که] ویژه کافران است، [و] آن را بازدارنده ای نیست.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: بر كافران فرود خواهد آمد و كس آن را دفع نتواند كرد،

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: كه مخصوص كافران است و دفع كننده‌اى ندارد

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: كه اختصاص به كافران دارد [و] آن را بازدارنده‌اى نيست.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: (بداند که) بر فرقه کافران است و هیچ کس از آنان دفع نتواند کرد.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: (این عذاب) گریبانگیر کافران می‌گردد، و هیچ کس نمی‌تواند آن را از ایشان باز دارد. [[«لِلْکَافِرِینَ»: واژه (لِ) می‌تواند به معنی (عَلی) باشد.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: که برای کافران است [و] بازدارنده‌ای ندارد

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: این عذاب مخصوص کافران است، و هیچ کس نمی‌تواند آن را دفع کند،

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: برای کافران نیستش بازدارنده‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: كه كافران را هيچ بازدارنده‌اى از آن نيست،

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: (عذابی) که اختصاص به کافران دارد (و) آن را بازدارنده‌ای نیست‌.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Upon the infidels -- which none would be able to repel --

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: - Upon the disbelievers – the punishment that none can avert.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: for the unbelievers, which none may avert,

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: The infidels, of which there is no averter.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Upon the disbelievers, which none can avert,

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: For the disbelievers; none can repel it.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: (a chastisement meant) for the unbelievers, one which none can avert;

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Upon the disbelievers, which none can avert,

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Upon the disbelievers, which none can repel,

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: —which none can avert from the faithless —

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: the unbelievers which none can prevent.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: To the disbelievers; of it there is no preventer.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: which will inevitably seize the disbelievers.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: The unbelievers-- there is none to avert it--

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Lilkafireena laysa lahu dafiAAun

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: to those who deny the truth. No power can hinder God

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: The Unbelievers, the which there is none to ward off,-

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: [این عذاب] از سوی خدای صاحب درجات است.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: از جانب خدا كه صاحب آسمانها.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و از جانب خداى صاحب درجات است

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: [و] از جانب خداوند صاحب درجات [و مراتب‌] است.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: که آن عذاب از (قهر) خدای مالک آسمانهاست (یا مراد عذاب واقع بر نعمان بن حارث است که به نصب خلافت علی علیه السلام بر رسول صلی اللّه علیه و آله و سلّم اعتراض کرد، رسول صلّی اللّه علیه و آله و سلّم فرمود: به امر خدا کردم. او گفت: اگر چنین است خدایا بر من عذابی فرست. فورا سنگی از آسمان بر فرقش رسید و هلاک شد).

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: از ناحیه‌ی خدائی به وقوع می‌پیوندد که صاحب درجات و مقامات عالی است. [[«ذِی‌الْمَعَارِجِ»: دارای درجات والا و مقامات بالا (نگا: روح المعانی، فی ظِلال‌القرآن). در معنی، برابر با (رَفِیعُ‌الدَّرَجاتِ) است (نگا: غافر / 15). «الْمَعَارِجِ»: جمع مَِعْرَج، محلّ صُعود. جای بالا رفتن (نگا: زخرف / 33). مراتب و منازل و درجات عظمت و رفعت و قدرت.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: از جانب خداوند صاحب درجات‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: از سوی خداوند ذی المعارج [= خداوندی که فرشتگانش بر آسمانها صعود و عروج می‌کنند]!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: از خدا خداوند نردبانها (معراجها)

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: از سوى خداى كه خداوند پايه‌هاى بلند است.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: (و) از جانب خدا (است)، صاحب (بخشایش) کل درجات‌.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: From God, the Lord of the steps (of progression),

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: From Allah, the Lord of all pinnacles.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: from God, the Lord of the Stairways.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: From Allah, Owner of the ascending steps.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: From Allah, the Lord of the ways of ascent.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: From God, Lord of the Ways of Ascent.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: a chastisement from Allah, the Lord of the ascending steps,

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: From Allah, the Lord of the ways of ascent.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: From Allah, Lord of the Ascending Stairways

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: from Allah, Lord of the lofty stations.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: (A punishment) from Allah, the Owner of the Elevated Passages.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: [It is] from Allah, owner of the ways of ascent.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: No one can defend him against God, the Lord of the exalted positions.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: From Allah, the Lord of the ways of Ascent.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Mina Allahi thee almaAAariji

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: from punishing them. He is the Lord of the Ascending Stairways,

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: (A Penalty) from Allah, Lord of the Ways of Ascent.

verses.text: تَعْرُجُ‌ الْمَلاَئِکَةُ وَ الرُّوحُ‌ إِلَيْهِ‌ فِي‌ يَوْمٍ‌ کَانَ‌ مِقْدَارُهُ‌ خَمْسِينَ‌ أَلْفَ‌ سَنَةٍ

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: فرشتگان و روح در روزی که مقدارش پنجاه هزار سال است به سوی او بالا می روند.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: در روزى كه مقدارش پنجاه هزار سال است، فرشتگان و روح بدان جا فراروند.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: فرشتگان و روح، در روزى كه مقدارش پنجاه هزار سال است به سوى او بالا مى‌روند

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: فرشتگان و روح، در روزى كه مقدارش پنجاه هزار سال است به سوى «او» بالا مى‌روند.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: فرشتگان و روح الامین (برای اخذ فرمان) به سوی (عرش) خدا بالا روند در روزی که مدتش پنجاه هزار سال خواهد بود.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: فرشتگان و جبرئیل به سوی او (پر می‌کشند و) بالا می‌روند در مدّتی که پنجاه هزار سال (معمولی برای انسانها) طول می‌کشد. [[«تَعْرُجُ»: بالا می‌رود. صعود می‌کند. «الرُّوحُ»: جبرئیل. ذکر آن به خاطر اهمّیّت ویژه جبرئیل در میان سائر فرشتگان است. اصلاً جبرئیل نماد بزرگی بوده و جنبه سردستگی فرشتگان را دارد. «یَوْمٍ»: مراد مدّت و زمان است. برخی آن را روز قیامت دانسته‌اند. «خَمْسِینَ أَلْفَ سَنَةٍ»: پنجاه هزار سالِ اینجا، و یا هزار سالِ سوره سجده، آیه 5، برای تکثیر است. روی هم رفته بیانگر این واقعیّت است که برابر الفبای انسانها، صدرنشینی خدا، آن اندازه بالا است که اگر انسانها بخواهند با وسائل معمولی و ساختار علمی خود به سوی او رهسپار شوند، هزار سال و چه بسا پنجاه هزار سال و بیشتر و کمتر طول بکشد. خلاصه خدا بر تخت سلطنت کائنات است و رفیع‌الدرجات است، و این ما را بس.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: که فرشتگان و روح در روزی که به اندازه پنجاه هزار سال [دنیوی‌] است به سوی او فرا می‌روند

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: فرشتگان و روح [= فرشته مقرّب خداوند] بسوی او عروج می‌کنند در آن روزی که مقدارش پنجاه هزار سال است!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: بالاروند فرشتگان و روح بسویش در روزی که اندازه آن است پنجاه هزار سال‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: فرشتگان و روح- فرشته همراه وحى- در روزى كه درازى آن پنجاه هزار سال است- از سالهاى دنيا- به سوى او بالا مى‌روند.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: فرشتگان و روح، در روزی که مقدارش پنجاه هزار سال است سویش بالا می‌روند.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: To whom the angels and the soul take a day to ascend, whose length is fifty thousand years.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: The angels and Jibreel, ascend towards Him – the punishment will befall on a day which spans fifty thousand years.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: To Him the angels and the Spirit mount up, in a day whereof the measure is fifty thousand years.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Whereby the angels ascend Unto Him and also the spirit, On a Day whereof the measure is fifty thousand years.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: The angels and the Ruh [Jibrael (Gabriel)] ascend to Him in a Day the measure whereof is fifty thousand years,

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Unto Him the angels and the Spirit ascend on a Day the duration of which is fifty thousand years.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: by which the angels and the Spirit ascend to Him in one Day the duration of which is fifty thousand years.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: The angels and the Ruh ascend to Him in a Day the measure whereof is fifty thousand years.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: (Whereby) the angels and the Spirit ascend unto Him in a Day whereof the span is fifty thousand years.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: The angels and the Spirit ascend to Him in a day whose span is fifty thousand years.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: To Him the angels and the Spirit (Gabriel) ascend in a day, the measure of which is fifty thousand years.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: The angels and the Spirit will ascend to Him during a Day the extent of which is fifty thousand years.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: On that Day (of Judgment), long as fifty thousand years, the angels and the Spirit will ascend to Him.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: To Him ascend the angels and the Spirit in a day the measure of which is fifty thousand years.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: TaAAruju almalaikatu waalrroohu ilayhi fee yawmin kana miqdaruhu khamseena alfa sanatin

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: by which the angels and the Spirit will ascend to Him in one Day which will last for fifty thousand years.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: The angels and the spirit ascend unto him in a Day the measure whereof is (as) fifty thousand years:

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: پس صبر کن صبری نیکو [صبری که در کنارش جزع و ناخشنودی نباشد.]

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: پس صبر كن صبرى نيكو.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: پس صبرى زيبا پيشه كن

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: پس صبر كن، صبرى نيكو.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: پس صبر نیکو پیش گیر.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: صبر جمیل داشته باش (و جزع و فزع و یأس و نومیدی به خود راه مده). [[«صَبْراً جَمِیلاً»: شکیبائی زیبا و قابل توجّه (نگا: یوسف / 18 و 83).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: پس صبری نیکو پیشه کن‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: پس صبر جمیل پیشه کن،

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: پس شکیبائی کن شکیبائی نکو

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: پس شكيبايى كن شكيبايى نيكو.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: پس صبرکن، صبری نیکو.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: So persevere with becoming patience.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Therefore patiently endure, in the best manner (O dear Prophet Mohammed – peace and blessings be upon him).

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: So be thou patient with a sweet patience;

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Wherefore be thou patient with a becoming patience.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: So be patient (O Muhammad SAW), with a good patience.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: So be patient, with sweet patience.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: So, (O Prophet), persevere with gracious perseverance.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: So be patient, with a good patience.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: But be patient (O Muhammad) with a patience fair to see.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: So be patient, with a patience that is graceful.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Therefore be patient, with a beautiful patience;

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: So be patient with gracious patience.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: (Muhammad), exercise patience with no complaints.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Therefore endure with a goodly patience.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Faisbir sabran jameelan

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Therefore, [O believers] behave with seemly patience.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Therefore do thou hold Patience,- a Patience of beautiful (contentment).

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: دشمنان و مخالفان، آن [عذاب] را دور می بینند

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: ايشان آن روز را دور مى‌بينند.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: همانا آنها آن [روز] را دور مى‌بينند

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: زيرا آنان [عذاب‌] را دور مى‌بينند،

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: که این مردم آن روز را بسیار دور (از امکان) بینند.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: آنان آن روز را بعید و دور می‌دانند. [[«یَرَوْنَهُ»: آن را می‌بینند. دیدن، به معنی دانستن، یا انگاشتن است.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: آنان آن را دوردست می‌بینند

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: زیرا آنها آن روز را دور می‌بینند،

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: که آنان بینندش دور

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: آنها آن- عذاب يا روز قيامت- را دور مى‌بينند،

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: بی‌گمان آن (عذاب) را دور می‌بینند،

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: They surely take it to be far away,

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: They deem it to be remote.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: behold, they see it as if far off;

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Verily they behold it afar off.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Verily! They see it (the torment) afar off,

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: They see it distant.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Verily they think that the chastisement is far off,

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Verily, they see it (the torment) afar off.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Lo! they behold it afar off

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Indeed they see it to be far off,

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: they see it as being far off;

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Indeed, they see it [as] distant,

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: They think that it (the Day of Judgment) is far away.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Surely they think it to be far off,

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Innahum yarawnahu baAAeedan

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: They see it [the Day of Judgement] to be far off,

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: They see the (Day) indeed as a far-off (event):

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و ما آن را نزدیک می بینیم.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: و ما نزديكش مى‌بينيم.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و ما نزديكش مى‌بينيم

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و [ما] نزديكش مى‌بينيم.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و ما نزدیک (به وقوع) می‌بینیم.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: و ما آن را ممکن و نزدیک می‌دانیم. [[«نَرَاهُ»: آن را می‌بینیم. دیدن، در اینجا به معنی دانستن است و بس.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و ما نزدیک می‌بینیمش‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: و ما آن را نزدیک می‌بینیم!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و ما بینیمش نزدیک‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و ما نزديكش مى‌بينيم.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و (ما) آن را نزدیکش می‌بینیم.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: But We see it very near.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Whereas We see it impending.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: but We see it is nigh.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And We behold it nigh.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: But We see it (quite) near.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: But We see it near.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: while We think that it is near at hand.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: But We see it near.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: While we behold it nigh:

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: and We see it to be near.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: but We see it near.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: But We see it [as] near.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: but We see it to be very near.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And We see it nigh.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Wanarahu qareeban

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: but We see it near at hand.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: But We see it (quite) near.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: روزى كه آسمان چون فلز گداخته گردد،

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: روزى كه آسمان چون فلز گداخته شود

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: روزى كه آسمانها چون فلز گداخته شود،

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: روزی که آسمان چون فلز گداخته شود.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: روزی، آسمان، همسان فلز گداخته‌ای می‌شود. [[«الْمُهْلِ»: (نگا: کهف / 29، دخان / 45).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: روزی که آسمان چون فلز گداخته شود

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: همان روز که آسمان همچون فلز گداخته می‌شود،

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: روزی که گردد آسمان چون روغن گداخته‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: روزى كه آسمان چون مس گداخته شود

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: روزی که آسمان‌ها چون ته‌مانده‌ی روغن زیتون گداخته است‌.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: The day the sky becomes like molten brass,

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: The day when the sky will be like molten silver.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Upon the day when heaven shall be as molten copper

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: It shall befall on a Day whereon the heaven shall become like Unto dregs of oil.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: The Day that the sky will be like the boiling filth of oil, (or molten copper or silver or lead, etc.).

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: On the Day when the sky will be like molten brass.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: It shall befall on a Day whereon the sky will become like molten brass,

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: The Day that the sky will be like the Al-Muhl.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: The day when the sky will become as molten copper,

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: The day when the sky will be like molten copper,

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: On that Day the heaven shall become like molten copper,

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: On the Day the sky will be like murky oil,

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: On the day when the heavens become like molten metal.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: On the day when the heaven shall be as molten copper

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Yawma takoonu alssamao kaalmuhli

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: On that Day the heavens shall become like molten brass,

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: The Day that the sky will be like molten brass,

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و کوه ها مانند پشم رنگینِ حلاجی شده شود

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: و كوه‌ها چون پشم،

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و كوه‌ها چون پشم زده شده [متلاشى‌] گردد

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و كوهها چون پشم زده گردد،

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و کوهها مانند پشم زده متلاشی گردند.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: و کوهها همسان پشم رنگین می‌گردد. [[«الْعِهْنِ»: پشم رنگین.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و کوهها همچون پشم رنگین گردد

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: و کوه‌ها مانند پشم رنگین متلاشی خواهد بود،

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و گردند کوه‌ها چون پشم‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و كوه‌ها مانند پشم رنگين [زده‌شده‌] گردد

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و کوه‌ها چون پشمِ زده شده است.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: The mountains like the tufts of (carded) wool,

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: And the hills will be light as wool.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: and the mountains shall be as plucked wool-tufts,

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And then the mountains shall become like Unto wool dyed.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: And the mountains will be like flakes of wool,

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: And the mountains will be like tufted wool.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: and the mountains will become like dyed tufts of wool,

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: And the mountains will be like `Ihn.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: And the hills become as flakes of wool,

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: and the mountains like [tufts of] dyed wool,

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: and the mountains shall be like puffs of wool.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And the mountains will be like wool,

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: and the mountains become like wool,

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And the mountains shall be as tufts of wool

translations.text: Watakoonu aljibalu kaalAAihni

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: and the mountains will become like tufts of wool,

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: And the mountains will be like wool,

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و هیچ خویشاوند و دوست صمیمی از [اوضاع و احوال] خویشاوند و دوست صمیمی اش نپرسد!

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: و هيچ خويشاوندى از حال خويشاوند خود نپرسد،

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و هيچ دوست صميمى از دوست صميمى [حال‌] نپرسد

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و هيچ دوست صميمى از دوست صميمى [حال‌] نپرسد،

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و هیچ کس از خویش خود جویا نشود.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: هیچ دوست صمیمی و خویشاوند نزدیکی، سراغ دوست صمیمی و خویشاوند نزدیکی را نمی‌گیرد و از او نمی‌پرسد! [[«حَمِیمٌ»: دوست صمیمی و گرم. خویشاوند نزدیک و گرم (نگا: المصحف‌المیسّر).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و هیچ خویشاوندی از حال خویشاوندی نپرسد

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: و هیچ دوست صمیمی سراغ دوستش را نمی‌گیرد!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و نپرسد دوستی دوستی را

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و هيچ خويشاوندى- يا دوستى- از [حال‌] خويشاوندى- يا دوستى- نپرسد.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و هیچ دوست صمیمی دوست صمیمی(اش) را نپرسد.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: And no friend inquires after friend

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: And no friend will ask concerning his friend.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: no loyal friend shall question loyal friend,

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And not a friend shall ask a friend,

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: And no friend will ask of a friend,

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: No friend will care about his friend.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: and no bosom friend will enquire about any of his bosom friends

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: And no friend will ask a friend,

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: And no familiar friend will ask a question of his friend

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: and no friend will inquire about [the welfare of his] friend,

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: No loyal friend will ask another loyal friend

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And no friend will ask [anything of] a friend,

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: even intimate friends will not inquire about their friends,

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And friend shall not ask of friend

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Wala yasalu hameemun hameeman

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: and no friend will ask about his friend,

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: And no friend will ask after a friend,

verses.text: يُبَصَّرُونَهُمْ‌ يَوَدُّ الْمُجْرِمُ‌ لَوْ يَفْتَدِي‌ مِنْ‌ عَذَابِ‌ يَوْمِئِذٍ بِبَنِيهِ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: آنان را نشانشان می دهند [ولی به خاطر دل مشغولی خود هرگز به آنان توجه نکنند!] گنهکار آرزو می کند که ای کاش می توانست فرزندانش را در برابر عذاب آن روز فدیه و عوض دهد!

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: يكديگر را برابر چشمشان آرند. گناهكار دوست دارد كه خويشتن را بازخرد به فرزندانش،

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: دوستان صميمى به آنها نشان داده مى‌شوند، [ولى هر كسى گرفتار كار خويش است.] گناهكار دوست مى‌دارد كه كاش براى رهايى از عذاب آن روز پسران خود را عوض دهد

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: آنان را به ايشان نشان مى‌دهند. گناهكار آرزو مى‌كند كه كاش براى رهايى از عذاب آن روز، مى توانست پسران خود را عوض دهد،

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: چون حقیقت حالشان به آنها بنمایند آن روز کافر بدکار آرزو کند که کاش توانستی فرزندانش را فدای خود سازد و از عذاب برهد.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: (دوستان صمیمی و خویشاوندان نزدیک) به همدیگر نشان داده می‌شوند و معرّفی می‌گردند (امّا هر کس گرفتار کار خویشتن است، و هول و هراس بیش از آن است که کسی بتواند به دیگری بیندیشد. وضع چنان است که) شخص گناهکار آرزو می‌کند کاش می‌شد برای رهائی خود از عذاب آن روز، پسران خود را فدا سازد. [[«یَفْتَدِی»: فدا سازد و خویشتن را باز رهاند. از ماده (فداء) به معنی حِفْظ کردن خود از مصائب و مشکلات، به وسیله پرداخت چیزی.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: در حالی که به همدیگر نشان داده شوند، گناهکار آرزو کند کاش عذاب چنین روزی را،

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: آنها را نشانشان می‌دهند (ولی هر کس گرفتار کار خویشتن است)، چنان است که گنهکار دوست می‌دارد فرزندان خود را در برابر عذاب آن روز فدا کند،

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: نمایانیده شوند بدیشان دوست دارد گناهکار کاش فدیه می‌داد از عذاب آن روز پسرانش‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: آنان- يعنى خويشانشان- را بديشان بنمايند- ولى كارى از آنها ساخته نيست-. بزهكار آرزو كند كه كاش مى‌توانست [براى فرار] از عذاب آن روز فرزندان خود را عوض دهد،

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: آنان به ایشان بس نشان داده می‌شوند. گناهکار دوست می‌دارد کاش برای رهایی از عذاب آن روز، می‌توانست پسران خود را (به جای خود) عوض دهد،

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Though within sight of one another. The sinner would like to ransom himself from the torment of that Day by offering his sons,

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: They will be seeing them; the guilty will wish if only he could redeem himself from the punishment of that day, by offering his sons.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: as they are given sight of them. The sinner will wish that he might ransom himself from the chastisement of that day even by his sons,

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Though they shall be made to see one another. Fain would the guilty ransom himself from the torment of that Day by his children.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Though they shall be made to see one another [(i.e. on the Day of Resurrection), there will be none but see his father, children and relatives, but he will neither speak to them nor will ask them for any help)], - the Mujrim, (criminal, sinner, disbeliever, etc.) would desire to ransom himself from the punishment of that Day by his children.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: They will be shown each other. The criminal wishes he would be redeemed from the punishment of that Day by his children.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: although they shall be within sight of one another. The guilty one would fain ransom himself from the torment of that Day by offering his children,

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Though they shall be made to see one another, the criminal would desire to ransom himself from the punishment of that Day by his children.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Though they will be given sight of them. The guilty man will long to be able to ransom himself from the punishment of that day at the price of his children

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: [though] they will be placed within each other’s sight. The guilty one will wish he could ransom himself from the punishment of that day at the price of his children,

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: though they are in sight of each other. To ransom himself from the punishment of that Day, the sinner will wish that he might even ransom himself by his sons,

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: They will be shown each other. The criminal will wish that he could be ransomed from the punishment of that Day by his children

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: though they may see each other. A sinner will wish that he could save himself from the torment of that day by sacrificing his children,

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: (Though) they shall be made to see each other. The guilty one would fain redeem himself from the chastisement of that day by (sacrificing) his children,

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Yubassaroonahum yawaddu almujrimu law yaftadee min AAathabi yawmiithin bibaneehi

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: though they shall be within sight of each other. The guilty one will gladly ransom himself from the torment of that Day by sacrificing his own children,

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Though they will be put in sight of each other,- the sinner's desire will be: Would that he could redeem himself from the Penalty of that Day by (sacrificing) his children,

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و نیز همسر و برادرش را

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: و زنش و برادرش،

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و [نيز] همسر و برادر خود را

translations.text: و [نيز] همسرش و برادرش را،

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و قبیله و قومش را که [در دنیا] به او پناه می دادند،

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: و عشيره‌اش كه او را مكان داده است،

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و اقوامش را كه به او پناه مى‌دادند

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و قبيله‌اش را كه به او پناه مى‌دهد،

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و هم خویشان و قبیله‌اش را که همیشه حمایتش می‌کردند.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: همچنین فامیل و قبیله و عشیره‌ای که او را در پناه خود می‌گرفتند. [[«فَصِیلَة»: قوم و قبیله. خانواده و فامیل. خویشاوندان نزدیک. «تُؤْوِیهِ»: او را در پناه خود می‌گیرد. او را منزل و مأوی می‌دهد.]]

translations.text: همچنین خاندانش که به او سر و سامان داده است‌

translations.text: و جداساخته‌اش [:مادرش] را که پناهش می‌دهد،

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و نیز همه کسانی را که در روی زمین اند تا [این فدیه و عوض] او را [از عذاب آن روز] نجات دهد!

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: و همه آنها كه در روى زمينند، و نجات يابد.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و هر كه را كه در روى زمين است همه را [عوض مى‌داد] و آن‌گاه خود را [از عذاب‌] مى‌رهانيد

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و هر كه را كه در روى زمين است همه را [عوض مى‌داد] و آنگاه خود را رها مى‌كرد.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و هر که را روی زمین است خواهد همه را فدای خویش گردند تا مگر او را (از آن عذاب) برهاند.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: و حتّی تمام کسانی را که در روی زمین هستند (همگی را فدا کند) تا این که مایه‌ی نجاتش شود. [[«یُنجِیهِ»: او را رستگار کند و مایه نجاتش شود. فاعل این فعل ضمیر مستتر است و به فداء بر می‌گردد.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: همچنین هر کس که در روی زمین است، آنگاه باز رهاندش‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: و همه مردم روی زمین را تا مایه نجاتش گردند؛

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و هر که در زمین است همگی پس برهاندش‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و هر كه را در زمين است، همه را يكجا، تا او را [از عذاب‌] برهاند،

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و هر که را که در روی زمین است‌، همه را (عوض دهد) و سپس خود را نجات دهد.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: And all those who are on the earth, to save himself.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: And all those who are in the earth – then only if the redemption saves him!

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: and whosoever is in the earth, all together, so that then it might deliver him.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And all who are on the earth; so that this might deliver him.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: And all that are in the earth, so that it might save him.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: And everyone on earth, in order to save him.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: and all persons of the earth, if only he could thus save himself.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: And all that are in the earth, so that it might save him.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: And all that are in the earth, if then it might deliver him.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: and all those who are upon the earth, if that might deliver him.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: and whosoever is in the earth, altogether, so that it might save him.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And whoever is on earth entirely [so] then it could save him.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: and all those on earth.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And all those that are in the earth, (wishing) then (that) this might deliver him.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Waman fee alardi jameeAAan thumma yunjeehi

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: and all the people of the earth, if that could deliver him.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: And all, all that is on earth,- so it could deliver him:

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: این چنین نیست [که برایش راه نجاتی باشد] همانا آتش زبانه می کشد،

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: هرگز نه، كه آن شعله آتش است،

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: نه، هرگز [نجاتى در كار نيست‌]. همانا آن آتشى شعله‌ور است

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: نه چنين است. [آتش‌] زبانه مى‌كشد،

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و هرگز نجات نیابد که آتش دوزخ بر او شعله‌ور است.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: هرگز! (این تمنّاها و آرزوها بر آورده نمی‌گردد، و هیچ فدیه و فدائی پذیرفته نمی‌شود). این، آتش سوزان و سراپا شعله (ی دوزخ) است. [[«إِنَّهَا)»: ضمیر (هَا) به (نَار) بر می‌گردد که عذاب بیانگر آن است. «لَظی»: زبانه صِرف و شعله خالص. نامی از نامهای دوزخ.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: حاشا، آن آتشی زبانه‌زن است‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: امّا هرگز چنین نیست (که با اینها بتوان نجات یافت، آری) شعله‌های سوزان آتش است،

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: نه چنین است همانا آن است شراره‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: هرگز، كه آن آتشى است زبانه‌كشنده،

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: نه چنین است. همانا آن (آتش) زبانه‌دار است.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: But never. It is pure white flame

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Never! That is indeed a blazing fire.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Nay, verily it is a furnace

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: By no means! Verily it is a Flame.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: By no means! Verily, it will be the Fire of Hell!

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: By no means! It is a Raging Fire.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: By no means! It will be the fierce flame

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: By no means! Verily, it will be the fire of Hell,

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: But nay! for lo! it is the fire of hell

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Never! Indeed, it is a blazing fire,

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: No, in truth, it is a Furnace!

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: No! Indeed, it is the Flame [of Hell],

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: By no means! For the raging flames of the fire

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: By no means! Surely it is a flaming fire

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Kalla innaha latha

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: But no! There is a raging blaze

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: By no means! for it would be the Fire of Hell!-

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: در حالی که دست و پا و پوست سر را بر می کند!!

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: پوست سر را مى‌كند،

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: بركننده‌ى پوست سر و اندام است

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: پوست سر و اندام را بركننده است.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: تا سر و صورت و اندمش پاک بسوزد.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: پوست بدن را می‌کند و با خود می‌برد. [[«نَزَّاعَةً»: سخت جدا کننده. به چابکی کننده و بَرنده. «الشَّوی»: پوست بدن. اعضاء و اندامهائی همچون دست و پا و گوش و بینی که به منزله شاخ و برگ درخت بدن هستند، چرا که آتش سوزان و شعله‌ور وقتی که به چیزی می‌رسد، اوّل اطراف و جوانب و شاخ و برگ آن را می‌سوزاند و جدا می‌کند. بعضی هم این واژه را جمع شَواء یا شَواة دانسته‌اند. که پوست سر است.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: برکننده پوست سر

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: دست و پا و پوست سر را می‌کند و می‌برد!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: کننده پوست‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: بركننده پوست سر- يا همه تن-،

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: پوست سر و اندام) بریان شده را بس برکَنَنده است.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: That would skin the scalp.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: A fire that melts the hide.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: snatching away the scalp,

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Flaying off the scalp-skin.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Taking away (burning completely) the head skin!

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: It strips away the scalps.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: that will strip off the scalp.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Nazza`ah the Shawa!

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Eager to roast;

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: which strips away the scalp.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: It snatches away by the scalps,

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: A remover of exteriors.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: will strip-off the flesh

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Dragging by the head,

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: NazzaAAatan lilshshawa

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: stripping away his skin,

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Plucking out (his being) right to the skull!-

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: هر که را به حق پشت کرده واز دعوت حق روی گردانده، می طلبد،

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: هر كه را كه به حق پشت كرد و از فرمان سرپيچيد به خود مى‌خواند،

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: فرا مى‌خواند هر كه را پشت كرده و [از دعوت حق‌] روى برتافته

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: هر كه را پشت كرده و روى برتافته،

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: دوزخ کسی را می‌خواند که از خدا رو گردانیده و با حق مخالفت کرده.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: به سوی خود می‌خواند (و نام می‌برد) کسی را که پشت (به فرمان خدا) کرده است و (از اطاعت او) روی‌گردان بوده است. [[«تَدْعُو»: صدا می‌زند. نام می‌برد. در رسم‌الخطّ قرآنی الف زائدی در آخر دارد.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: که هر کس را که [به حق‌] پشت کرد و [از ایمان‌] روی گرداند، به خود می‌خواند

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: و کسانی را که به فرمان خدا پشت کردند صدا می‌زند،

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: می‌خواند آن را که پشت کرد و روی برتافت‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: مى خواند هر كه را [به ايمان و طاعت‌] پشت كرد و روى بگردانيد.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: هر که را پشت کرده و روی برتافته است (به خود) می‌خواند.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: It will summon whoever turns his back and flees,

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: It calls out to him who reverted and turned away.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: calling him who drew back and turned away,

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: It shall calll him who turneth back and backslideth.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Calling: "[O Kafir (O disbeliever in Allah, His angels, His Book, His Messengers, Day of Resurrection and in Al-Qadar (Divine Preordainments), O Mushrik (O polytheist, disbeliever in the Oneness of Allah)] (all) such as turn their backs and turn away their faces (from Faith) [picking and swallowing them up from that great gathering of mankind (on the Day of Resurrection) just as a bird picks up a food-grain from the earth with its beak and swallows it up] [Tafsir Al-Qurtubi, Vol. 18, Page 289]

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: It invites him who once turned his back and fled.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: It shall insistently summon him who turned his back and retreated,

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Calling (all) such as turn their backs and turn away their faces.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: It calleth him who turned and fled (from truth),

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: It invites him, who has turned back [from the truth] and forsaken [it],

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: and it shall call him who withdrew and turned his back

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: It invites he who turned his back [on truth] and went away [from obedience]

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: and drag into it anyone who has turned away (from obeying God),

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: It shall claim him who turned and fled (from truth),

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: TadAAoo man adbara watawall<u>a</u>

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: and it will claim all those who turned their backs [on the true faith] and turned away [from the truth],

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Inviting (all) such as turn their backs and turn away their faces (from the Right).

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و آن را که ثروت جمع کرده و به ذخیره سازی و انباشتن پرداخته، می خواند؛

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: و آن را كه گردمى‌آورد و مى‌اندوخت.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و [مال‌] گردآورده و ذخيره نموده است

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و گرد آورده و انباشته [و حسابش را نگاه داشته‌] فرا مى‌خواند.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و مال دنیا را جمع کرده و همه را ذخیره نموده است.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: و دارائی را جمع آورده است و در خزینه‌ها نگاهداری کرده است (و در خیرات و حسنات آن را مصرف ننموده است). [[«أَوْعی»: در گنجینه‌ها نگاه داشته است. یعنی ثروت را فقط انباشته و نگاه داشته و در راه خدا مصرف نکرده است.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: همان کسی که مال اندوخت و جا به جا کرد

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: و (همچنین آنها که) اموال را جمع و ذخیره کردند!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و گردآورد پس نگهداشت‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و [مال را] گرد كرد و بيندوخت.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و گردآورده(هایی) پس (آن را) انباشته‌.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Who amasses and then hoards.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: And accumulated wealth and hoarded it.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: who amassed and hoarded.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And masseth and then hoardeth.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: And collect (wealth) and hide it (from spending it in the Cause of Allah).

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: And accumulated and hoarded.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: and amassed wealth and covetously hoarded it.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: And collect (wealth) and hide it (from spending it in the cause of Allah).

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: And hoarded (wealth) and withheld it.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: amassing [wealth] and hoarding [it].

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: and amassed (riches) and hoarded.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And collected [wealth] and hoarded.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: and who accumulated wealth without spending it for a good purpose.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And amasses (wealth) then shuts it up.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: WajamaAAa faawAA<u>a</u>

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: and amassed wealth and hoarded it.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: And collect (wealth) and hide it (from use)!

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: همانا انسان حریص و بی تاب آفریده شده است؛

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: هر آينه آدمى را حريص و ناشكيبا آفريده‌اند.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: به راستى انسان بسيار حريص [و بى‌تاب‌] خلق شده است

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: به راستى كه انسان سخت آزمند [و بى‌تاب‌] خلق شده است.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: که انسان مخلوقی طبعا سخت حریص و بی‌صبر است.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: آدمی کم‌طاقت و ناشکیبا، آفریده شده است. [[«هَلُوعاً»: کم طاقت. ناشکیبا. آیه‌های 20 و 21 تفسیر و تبیین (هَلُوع) است.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: بی‌گمان انسان ناشکیب آفریده شده است‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: به یقین انسان حریص و کم‌طاقت آفریده شده است،

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: همانا انسان آفریده شده است آزمند

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: همانا آدمى ناشكيبا- يا حريص- آفريده شده

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: به‌راستی انسان سخت آزمند (و بی‌تاب) خلق شده است.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Surely man is greedy by nature.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Indeed man is created very impatient, greedy.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Surely man was created fretful,

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Verily man is formed impatient.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Verily, man (disbeliever) was created very impatient;

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Man was created restless.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Verily man is impatient by nature:

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Verily, man was created very impatient;

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Lo! man was created anxious,

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Indeed man has been created covetous:

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Indeed, the human was created grudging and impatient.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Indeed, mankind was created anxious:

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: Human beings are created greedy.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Surely man is created of a hasty temperament

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Inna alinsana khuliqa halooAAan

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Indeed, man is born impatient:

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Truly man was created very impatient;-

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: چون آسیبی به او رسد، بی تاب است،

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: چون شرى بدو رسد بيقرارى كند.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: چون آسيبى به او رسد بى‌تاب است

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: چون صدمه‌اى به او رسد عجز و لابه كند.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: چون شر و زیانی به او رسد سخت جزع و بی‌قراری کند.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: هنگامی که بدی بدو رو می‌کند، سخت بی‌تاب و بیقرار می‌گردد. [[«جَزُوعاً»: بسیار بی‌تاب و بیقرار. کسی که بسیار داد و فریاد و جزع و فزع به راه می‌اندازد. حال است.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: چون شر به او رسد، بی‌تاب است‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: هنگامی که بدی به او رسد بیتابی می‌کند،

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: گاهی که رسدش بدیی نالان‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: چون بدى [و رنجى‌] بدو رسد بيتاب است

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: چون صدمه‌ای به او در رسد جزع و لابه‌کُننده است.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: If evil befalls him he is perturbed;

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Very nervous when touched by misfortune.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: when evil visits him, impatient,

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: When evil toucheth him, he is bewailing.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Irritable (discontented) when evil touches him;

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Touched by adversity, he is fretful.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: bewailing when evil befalls him,

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Apprehensive when evil touches him;

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Fretful when evil befalleth him

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: anxious when an ill befalls him

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: When evil comes upon him he is impatient;

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: When evil touches him, impatient,

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: When they are afflicted, they complain,

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Being greatly grieved when evil afflicts him

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Itha massahu alshsharru jazooAAan

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: when misfortune touches him he starts lamenting,

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Fretful when evil touches him;

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و هنگامی که خیر و خوشی [و مال و رفاهی] به او رسد، بسیار بخیل و بازدارنده است،

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: و چون مالى به دستش افتد بخل مى‌ورزد.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و چون خيرى به او رسد بخل ورز است

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و چون خيرى به او رسد بخل ورزد.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و چون مال و دولتی به او رو کند منع (احسان) نماید.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: و زمانی که خوبی بدو رو می‌کند، سخت (از حسنات و خیرات دست باز می‌دارد و) دریغ می‌ورزد. [[«مَنُوعاً»: بسیار دریغ کننده. بسیار دست باز دارنده.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و چون خیر به او رسد، بازدارنده است‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: و هنگامی که خوبی به او رسد مانع دیگران می‌شود (و بخل می‌ورزد)،

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و گاهی که رسدش خوبیی خودداری‌کنان‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و چون نعمتى [و رفاهى‌] بدو رسد بازدارنده است- بخل ورزد-

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و چون خیری به او رسد (آن را از دیگران) بازدارنده است.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: If good comes to him he holds back his hand,

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: And refraining, when good reaches him.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: when good visits him, grudging,

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And when good toucheth him he is begrudging.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: And niggardly when good touches him;

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Touched by good, he is ungenerous.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: and tight-fisted when good fortune visits him,

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: And suppressive when good touches him.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: And, when good befalleth him, grudging;

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: and grudging [charity] when good comes his way

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: but when good comes upon him, he is grudging

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And when good touches him, withholding [of it],

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: but when they are fortunate, they become niggardly

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And niggardly when good befalls him

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Waitha massahu alkhayru manooAAan

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: and whenever good fortune comes to him, he grows niggardly.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: And niggardly when good reaches him;-

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: مگر نماز گزاران،

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: مگر نماز گزارندگان:

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: غير از نمازگزاران

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: غير از نمازگزاران:

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: مگر نماز گزاران حقیقی.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: مگر نمازگزاران.

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: مگر نمازگزاران‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: مگر نمازگزاران،

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: مگر نمازگزاران‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: مگر نمازگزاران

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: بجز نمازگزاران،

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Except those who closely follow (the Book of God),

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Except those who establish prayer.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: save those that pray

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Not so are the prayerful.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Except those devoted to Salat (prayers)

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Except the prayerful.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: except those that pray,

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Except those who are devoted to Salah.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Save worshippers.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: —[all are such] except the prayerful,

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: except those that pray

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Except the observers of prayer -

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: except those who are steadfast

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Except those who pray,

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Illa almusalleena

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: But not so the worshippers

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Not so those devoted to Prayer;-

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: آنان که همواره بر نمازشان مداوم و پایدارند،

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: آنان كه به نماز مداومت مى‌ورزند،

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: همان كسانى كه بر نمازشان پايدارند

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: همان كسانى كه بر نمازشان پايدارى مى‌كنند.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: آنان که دایم در نماز (و طاعت الهی) عمر گذرانند.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: نمازگزارانی که همیشه نماز خود را به موقع می‌خوانند و بر آن مداومت و مواظبت دارند. [[«دَآئِمُونَ»: جمع دائم، همیشه ماندگار. مراد این نیست که نمازگزار همیشه در حال نماز باشد، بلکه منظور این است که در اوقات معیّن خود نماز را انجام دهد، و همیشه چنین بوده و دائماً مواظب و متوجّه باشد که نماز او فوت نشود.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: آنان که در نمازهایشان پیگیرند

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: آنها که نمازها را پیوسته بجا می‌آورند،

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: آنان که بر نماز خویشند پیوستگان‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: آنان كه بر نماز خويش پيوسته و پاينده‌اند

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: آنان که ایشان بر نمازشان پایدار‌انند.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Who persevere in devotion,

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Those who are regular in their prayers.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: and continue at their prayers,

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Who are at their prayer constant.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Those who remain constant in their Salat (prayers);

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Those who are constant at their prayers.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: and are constant in their Prayer;

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Those who with their Salah are Da'imun;

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Who are constant at their worship

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: those who persevere in their prayers

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: who are constant in prayer;

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Those who are constant in their prayer

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: and constant in their prayers.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Those who are constant at their prayer

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Allatheena hum AAala salatihim daimoona

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: who are steadfast in prayer;

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Those who remain steadfast to their prayer;

verses.text: وَ الَّذِينَ‌ فِي‌ أَمْوَالِهِمْ‌ حَقٌ‌ مَعْلُومٌ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و آنان که در اموالشان حقّی معلوم است

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: و آنان كه در اموالشان حقى است معين،

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و همانان كه در اموالشان حقى معين است

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و همانان كه در اموالشان حقى معلوم است،

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و آنان که در مال و دایی خود حقّی معیّن و معلوم گردانند.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: همان کسانی که در دارائی ایشان سهم مشخّصی است. [[«حَقٌّ مَّعْلُومٌ»: مراد سهمی است غیر از زکات که صدقه و بذل و بخشش می‌کند (نگا: قاسمی).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و کسانی که در اموالشان حقی معین است‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: و آنها که در اموالشان حق معلومی است...

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و آنان که در خواسته‌های ایشان است بهره دانسته‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و آنان كه در مالهاشان حقى است معلوم- مانند زكات و صدقات-،

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و (هم) آنان که در اموالشان حقی معلوم است،

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: In whose wealth a due share is included

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: And those in whose wealth exists a recognised right,

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: those in whose wealth is a right known

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And those in whose riches is a known right.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: And those in whose wealth there is a known right,

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: And those in whose wealth is a rightful share.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: and those in whose wealth there is a known right

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: And those in whose wealth there is a recognized right.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: And in whose wealth there is a right acknowledged

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: and there is a known share in whose wealth

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: who, from their wealth is a known right

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And those within whose wealth is a known right

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: They are those who assign a certain share of their property

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And those in whose wealth there is a fixed portion.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Waallatheena fee amwalihim haqqun maAAloomun

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: those who give a due share of their wealth

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: And those in whose wealth is a recognised right.

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: برای درخواست کننده [تهیدست] و محروم [از معیشت و ثروت،]

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: براى گدا و محروم.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: براى سائل و محروم

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: براى سائل و محروم.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: تا به فقیران سائل و فقیران آبرومند محروم رسانند.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: برای دادن به گدا و بی‌چیز. [[«الْمَحْرُوم»: بی‌بهره از دارائی. بی‌چیز. مراد نیازمندی است که گدائی نمی‌کند و دست نیاز به سوی کسی دراز نمی‌نماید. کسی که درآمدش کفاف زندگیش را نمی‌کند.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: برای خواهنده و بی‌بهره‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: برای تقاضاکننده و محروم،

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: برای دریوزه و بینوا

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: براى نيازمند خواهنده و بينواى درمانده

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: برای سائل و محروم.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: For the needy and those dispossessed,

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: For those who beg, and for the needy who cannot even ask.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: for the beggar and the outcast,

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: For the beggar and the destitute.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: For the beggar who asks, and for the unlucky who has lost his property and wealth, (and his means of living has been straitened);

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: For the beggar and the deprived.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: for those that ask and those that are dispossessed,

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: For the one who asks, and for the deprived.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: For the beggar and the destitute;

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: for the beggar and the deprived,

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: for the impoverished nonrequester and the requester,

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: For the petitioner and the deprived -

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: for the needy and the deprived,

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: For him who begs and for him who is denied (good)

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Lilssaili waalmahroomi

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: to those who ask [for help] and to the destitute;

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: For the (needy) who asks and him who is prevented (for some reason from asking);

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و آنان که همواره روز پاداش را باور دارند،

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: و كسانى كه روز قيامت را تصديق مى‌كنند،

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و كسانى كه روز جزا را باور دارند

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و كسانى كه روز جزا را باور دارند.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و آنان که روز قیامت و جزا را تصدیق کنند.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: آن کسانی که به روز جزا و سزا ایمان دارند. [[«یَوْمِ الدِّینِ»: (نگا: فاتحه / 4). روز قیامت.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و کسانی که روز جزا را باور می‌دارند

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: و آنها که به روز جزا ایمان دارند،

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: آنان که تصدیق کنند به روز دین‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و آنان كه روز پاداش را باور دارند

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و کسانی که روز جزا را باور دارند،

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: And those who believe in the Day of Judgement,

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: And those who believe the Day of Judgement to be true.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: who confirm the Day of Doom

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And those who testify to the Day of Requital.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: And those who believe in the Day of Recompense,

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: And those who affirm the Day of Judgment.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: those who firmly believe in the Day of Recompense,

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: And those who believe in the Day of Recompense.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: And those who believe in the Day of Judgment,

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: and who affirm the Day of Retribution,

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: who confirm the Day of Reckoning

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And those who believe in the Day of Recompense

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: who acknowledge the Day of Judgment,

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And those who accept the truth of the judgment day

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Waallatheena yusaddiqoona biyawmi alddeeni

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: and those who believe in the Day of Judgement
